intro: Barrosoa viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered barrosoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
